title: Megyn Kelly will return to Fox News for one night as Tucker Carlson's guest
text:
Megyn Kelly will be returning to the Fox News Channel - for one night, that is.

The former prime time star who left Rupert Murdoch’s cable network to go to NBC where she was fired for comments about wearing blackface is scheduled to appear on Tucker Carlson’s nightly gabfest on Wednesday.

It will mark the first time since early 2017 that Kelly will appear on the Fox News airwaves, where she made her career breakthrough.

But Kelly’s appearance is a one-off and that nobody should expect a full-time reunion.

'Megyn Kelly’s forthcoming guest appearance on “Tucker Carlson Tonight” was coordinated weeks ago and is a one-time occurrence,’ the network said in a statement.

Carlson announced Kelly's upcoming appearance on his show on Monday.

Tucker Carlson (left) will interview Megyn Kelly (right) on his Fox News show on Wednesday night, the network confirmed

‘Any future programming changes we are considering do not involve her.’

The network does have one high-profile opening in its 3pm time slot after Shepherd Smith, the longtime breaking news anchor, stunned the broadcasting world on Friday when he announced on air that he was leaving Fox.

Smith’s departure came as a shock. He had been criticized by President Trump and his supporters - among them prominent Fox News personalities - for his coverage of the news.

For his Wednesday show, Carlson is reportedly planning to talk to Kelly about media bias. The conversation is likely to delve into her tumultuous 18-month tenure at NBC News.

The Peacock network’s news division has been making headlines in recent days in the wake of Ronan Farrow’s bombshell new book.

In Catch and Kill, Farrow accuses senior NBC News executives of suppressing reports of sexual abuse by former Today show star co-host Matt Lauer and disgraced Hollywood film producer Harvey Weinstein.

Farrow alleges that NBC News made numerous six- and seven-figure payouts to women who say they were victimized by Lauer.

It will be Kelly's first appearance on television since October 23, 2018, when she tearfully apologized for saying that it was once acceptable to wear blackface. NBC announced that her show would be canceled the next day

He also claims that NBC News, his former employer, tried to stop him from investigating Weinstein for fear that the film mogul would reveal details of Lauer’s behavior and his boss’s alleged coverup and attempts to silence women.

Noah Oppenheim, the president of NBC News, denies Farrow’s allegations, saying they are a ‘smear’ and a ‘conspiracy theory’ from someone with ‘an axe to grind.’

Farrow’s book contains more allegations against Lauer that were previously unreported, including an alleged rape of a female colleague in his hotel room in Sochi in 2014.

Lauer is also alleged to have exposed himself to a Today producer while the two were chatting in his office.

Both women were said to have received substantial payouts from the network which barred them from speaking to the press about their experiences with Lauer.

Kelly is reported to have angered her bosses at NBC News by inviting one of Lauer's accusers on her morning program.

Before joining NBC News, Kelly spoke of being sexually harassed by her former boss at Fox, the late Roger Ailes.

Kelly's former employer, NBC News, is under scrutiny after a new book by journalist Ronan Farrow alleges that network bosses knew of former Today co-host Matt Lauer's alleged behavior toward women and tried to cover it up through payouts and nondisclosure deals

Ailes resigned in disgrace in 2016 after at least 20 women, among them Gretchen Carlson, Kelly, and Laurie Luhn, alleged that they were subjected to unwanted sexual advances from the longtime Fox News CEO.

Kelly, whose short tenure at NBC News was marred by low ratings and rumblings of tension in the workplace, was paid a lump sum of $30million, which is how much was left on the original $69million contract she signed with the Peacock Network in 2017.

She was let go unceremoniously after she said during an October 23 taping of her show that that when she was younger, it was common for whites to dress up as blacks for Halloween and that there was nothing inherently racist in doing so.

A fierce backlash on social media ensued, with many criticizing Kelly for failing to appreciate how blacks have historically been depicted with stereotypes that perpetuated racism.

The next day, Kelly held back tears as she apologized on air. That was her last appearance on NBC's air.

Kelly’s exit from NBC News was finalized after months of painstaking negotiations over what she can say about her now-former bosses and colleagues.

As per the terms of her $30million severance agreement with the Peacock Network, Kelly will not be permitted to dish dirt about what took place behind the scenes at 30 Rockefeller Plaza.

NBC management insisted in talks with Kelly that she sign the non-disparagement clause in exchange for her receiving the full sum of the original $69million contract she signed with the network in the summer of 2017.
description: The former prime time star who left Rupert Murdoch's cable network to go to NBC where she was fired for comments about blackface will appear on Tucker Carlson's show on Wednesday.
